titles: To the supreme authority of the nation, the Commons of England, in Parliament assembled. The humble petition of divers young men, and apprentices of the city of London, and parts adjacent. In behalf of Lieut. Col. John Lilburn, M. William Walwin, M. Thomas Prince, and M. Richard Overton, now close prisoners in the Tower of London, without any declared just cause: and of Capt. Willam Bray in the same condition in Windsor Castle.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Detention of persons --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Prisoners --  Legal status, laws, etc. --  Early works to 1800.
